citations.narrative:
Outdoor enclosures contain surfaces that are not impervious to moisture:
•An outdoor enclosure housing 4 Havapoo puppies and 3 Cavapoo puppies has a wood shelter structure that is not
impervious to moisture. During the inspection, the facility moved the puppies to a compliant enclosure.
•An outdoor enclosure housing 4 adult Boxers contains fence posts and a shelter structure made of wood that is not
impervious to moisture
Surfaces in contact with the animals that are not impervious to moisture can absorb moisture and harbor bacteria while
being unable to be properly cleaned and sanitized possibly exposing the animals to disease hazards. Building surfaces in
contact with animals in outdoor housing facilities must be impervious to moisture. Correct by ensuring that all surfaces of
outdoor housing facilities- including houses, dens, etc. – are impervious to moisture and surfaces that cannot be readily
cleaned and sanitized are replaced when worn or soiled. Correct by 21-OCTOBER-2025.

An enclosure housing 4 Havapoo puppies and 3 Cavapoo puppies had sharp points. The sharp points consisted of
several rows of barbed wire adjacent to the wall of the enclosure that are accessible to the animals. Failure to maintain
enclosures without accessible sharp points can result in injury to the animals. Correct by ensuring that primary enclosures
are constructed and maintained so that they have no sharp points or edges that could injure the animals. During the
inspection, the facility moved the puppies to a compliant enclosure. Correct by 7-OCTOBER-2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
n

narrative:
3.4(c) 
   
Outdoor housing facilities. 
Outdoor enclosures contain surfaces that are not impervious to moisture: 
 
•An outdoor enclosure housing 4 Havapoo puppies and 3 Cavapoo puppies has a wood shelter structure that is not 
impervious to moisture. During the inspection, the facility moved the puppies to a compliant enclosure. 
 
•An outdoor enclosure housing 4 adult Boxers contains fence posts and a shelter structure made of wood that is not 
impervious to moisture 
 
Surfaces in contact with the animals that are not impervious to moisture can absorb moisture and harbor bacteria while 
being unable to be properly cleaned and sanitized possibly exposing the animals to disease hazards. Building surfaces in 
contact with animals in outdoor housing facilities must be impervious to moisture. Correct by ensuring that all surfaces of 
outdoor housing facilities- including houses, dens, etc. – are impervious to moisture and surfaces that cannot be readily 
cleaned and sanitized are replaced when worn or soiled. Correct by 21-OCTOBER-2025. 
3.6(a)(2)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
An enclosure housing 4 Havapoo puppies and 3 Cavapoo puppies had sharp points. The sharp points consisted of 
several rows of barbed wire adjacent to the wall of the enclosure that are accessible to the animals. Failure to maintain 
enclosures without accessible sharp points can result in injury to the animals. Correct by ensuring that primary enclosures 
are constructed and maintained so that they have no sharp points or edges that could injure the animals. During the 
inspection, the facility moved the puppies to a compliant enclosure. Correct by 7-OCTOBER-2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
